website_summaries.verdict: A solid sprayer that will do a splendid job and will suit most of the needs of the average homeowner.
pros: Maintains pressure and stream is easy to adjust
Well-built and portable - a good size for those with an average-sized residential lawn

customer_reviews.title: 2 gallon size is best
customer_reviews.text: If you're trying to decide between the 1 and 2 gallon Chapin sprayer, I recommend the 2 gallon because you can still fill it with only 1 gallon and then use the remaining gallon as a larger air spring. The larger air spring volume will make it easier to pump and spray longer.
customer_reviews.author: D. Coral

customer_reviews.title: rendering this product useless. The latter happened to me
customer_reviews.text: The locking mechanism on stem of handle consists of a tiny plastic tab. If you don't tighten this mechanism up enough, air will escape and it won't do the job. If you tighten it up too much, the tiny plastic tab will break... rendering this product useless. The latter happened to me. Received this product a week ago, and it's worthless after only 2 uses. Don't even know if it's worth the effort to try to return this product since I already tossed the packaging in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: I am returning this sprayer, as it just won't ...
customer_reviews.text: I am returning this sprayer, as it just won't work. I have been an avid gardener for over 40 years and know how to use this product, but It won't work. You pump it and pump it till you feel the resistance, but then when you go to spray it, hardly anything comes out. I brought it to 2 garden centers and they couldn't get it to work either.
customer_reviews.author: Carol M. Couture

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer is amazing! I bought it to spray my yellow spots in my lawn with LawnStar. I used the Home Depot HDX brand last year and it got clogged every 5 minutes. It was very frustrating. This sprayer didn't get clogged once and I was able to spray my lawn much faster!
customer_reviews.author: Rebekahra

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic garden sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic garden sprayer. There is some assembly that is required but it is very easy and can be done by hand. I use this for all sorts of things around the yard: spraying cleaner on the fence, spraying fertilizer on the lawn, spraying pesticides, etc. It is held up very well and is sturdily made. I threaded a hole in the side and installed a tire valve so that I did not have to maintain air pressure by pumping. All I have to do is air it up using my air compressor.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Seam burst
customer_reviews.text: I filled this with an oxyclean solution so that I could spray down my roof deck. The sprayer was slightly pressurized and as I was carrying it up to the deck the seam at the bottom sprung a leak and flooded inside the house. I am not happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Homer

customer_reviews.title: It looks good in the recycling bin
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived on time and in perfect condition. Box is undamaged. First time I used it I got soaked. A fine spray of liquid is coming out of the bottom of the tank. I ended up just aiming the bottom of the tank at my tomato plants since the spray out of the bottom of the tank was better than the spray out of the cheap wand. Went to "Hazard Fraught", bought a two gallon sprayer with a 20% off coupon and paid less for it. A much higher quality product and it doesn't leak from crappy HF. Go figure..
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this garden sprayer in January so we would have it when the weather turned nice and we could work in the yard. That's been about two weeks now, and the sprayer lasted through two uses. Of course because we ordered it early, the return window is closed. We are avid Amazon buyers and among the earliest Prime members. We'll still use Amazon but we will steer clear of this brand. Our one star rating denotes one decent use, followed by a dying product. Our advice is to pass this product by.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Great for liquid fertilizer or pest issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year to use on my rooftop garden and had great results. It was used for foliar fertilizer, compost tea spray, organic fungicide applications and organic pest repllent. It is easy to use and the sorsy can be used for an even most or a more direct application by adjusting the front knob. I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a high quality garden sprayer that is light and efficient.
customer_reviews.author: LJGBrooklyn

customer_reviews.title: Worth a few extra dollars.
customer_reviews.text: I tried to save a couple dollars (and for convenience) I bought the 2-gallon Flo-Master from WalMart. I felt pretty good about my purchase until, within a few months, the pump seal weakened and it became difficult to get air into it. Also, the spray pattern is difficult to maintain on the Flo-Master. I also have a 1-Gallon Chapin and it has held up nicely and is a pleasure to use. So I finally got the 2-Gallon Chapin and so far it seems to solve all the problems the Flo-Master presents.
customer_reviews.author: Chubby Checkers

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: This Chapin 2 gallon sprayer was delivered on March 15, 2019. First "use" was May 28, 2019. From time of delivery until until May 28 it sat in my garage protected from the elements. Yesterday I was going to use it for first time. It wouldn't hold pressure. Thirty plus pumps and maybe 30 seconds of use. Air leaks from the funnel and the hose connection. No amount of tightening would seal at either point. Save your money and buy something else. I can not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: DavidL48

customer_reviews.title: I might have gotten a bad one. I read the reviews
customer_reviews.text: I might have gotten a bad one. I read the reviews. My unit would not hold air. It leaked at the bottle and sprayer. I tightened everything but it never would hold air. Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: lrock

customer_reviews.title: tank exploded covering me with chemicals
customer_reviews.text: This tank exploded today while I was using it to spray weed killer I am at it less than one year and I clean it every time after I use it. I rinse out the tank and then flush out the hose for clean water. I own two other tanks that I've had for over five years and they're working fine this one explodes after less than a year when it exploded it sprayed me with the chemicals and I was lucky not to been injured or seriously maimed for life this has taught me to never buy the cheapest chemical spraying tank it's not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: kknutson

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer WAS great, but the plastic nodes on the pump break ...
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 2 months. Sprayer is great, but the plastic nodes on the pump break pretty easily. was trying to open the pump and relieve pressure to add more water and the plastic pieces snapped. Ordered another one bc it is a solid pump otherwise Update: Same thing happened. Plastic didnt snap, but it bends so that it effectively "strips" the ability to unscrew it. I cannot recommend this even though it is a solid unit as there is a manufacturing defect that needs to be addressed.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: broke after 6 uses but is a decent sprayer.
customer_reviews.text: I love this sprayer its easier to handle than my other sprayer's, the only issue I have is I used it 6 times and the hose connector blew apart and smacked me in my face when I was spraying my peppers. I'm not very pleased with that happening. This is a great sprayer, I wish it had a bent nozzle on the end so it was even easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: wew lad

customer_reviews.title: Slips loose and drops
customer_reviews.text: Ever pump up a sprayer, walk 10 feet and have the whole thing suddenly drop. After pumping, push down and twist the handle to lock it in place. Trouble is it does NOT stay locked. You get a sudden jolt as 16 pounds of liquid in the container suddenly drops. This has a nice spray tip but the handle lock is trash. I would never recommend this sprayer. It is junk ... unless you are trying to dislocate your sholder.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Improvised camp shower.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and maintains pressure. Added a kitchen sink hose with trigger for a cheap camping shower.
customer_reviews.author: That XJ guy

customer_reviews.title: LESSON: TEST with regular water before filling with anything else
customer_reviews.text: received. filled with solution. began to leak all over my floor from the bottom of the canister. found a container to pour remaining solution into and save for later. logged on. requested refund. ordered another. lets hope this 2nd one is NOT DEFECTIVE. LESSON: TEST with regular water before filling with anything else
customer_reviews.author: LuvLife2Day

customer_reviews.title: Does not have a pressure release safety valve.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised this unit does not have a safety pressure relief value. I thought that was a mandatory safety feature on these sprayers but I was wrong. There is a warning label on the pump handle about excessive pressures. I needed to use it right away otherwise I would have retured it. I will be shopping for a safer alternative very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: John V

customer_reviews.title: Chaplin cut a couple of key corners...
customer_reviews.text: Does what it’s supposed to do. Bought it because it was made in the USA, but disappointed in the hose and wand. Flimsy and cheap. They could have spend a couple of more dollars for a reinforced hose and a slightly thicker plastic wand. I get that it doesn’t include a brass wand for the price. So I’m not asking for all the bells or even a pressure release valve (didn’t have one either)...but come on, Chapin! Leave the cheap China stuff to the others.
customer_reviews.author: JoeM

customer_reviews.title: PIECE OF JUNK with NO PRESSURE RELIEF VALVE
customer_reviews.text: Reviews were great so I gave this a try. Pressure is minimal so you have to constantly pump it. Cannot lick the hand part for a constant spray. There is no pressure relief valve so when you’re done using it and want to clean it, you have to open the top. Since you cannot get 0% pressure, mist is released whuch can get on you. VERY DISAPPOINTED.
customer_reviews.author: debar57

customer_reviews.title: Good Sprayer For The Price
customer_reviews.text: Received this sprayer today (the 2 Gallon). I sprayed 4 gallons of weed killer through it, and was pretty impressed. My only complaint is that the tabs on the pump shaft (for locking the handle down to carry) get hit when you pump it up. So you've got to be really careful to not bust them off, otherwise your handle won't lock down, and it'll be a pain to carry around. I saw someone else's review where the tabs actually did break off.. So as long as you're careful while pumping it up, this should last you awhile. It seems like a good sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Good, Cheap Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: The assembly was easy, and the seals were stable and secure to hold pressure. I filled it 2/3 full of water and pumped it about ten times maximum to get a good stream and the nozzle produced with refinement a mist that would be perfect for fruit trees and flowers. I have used cheap sprayer before and typically the main problem has been the o-ring seal breaking. This one is a little different seal so I hope it lasts longer. Mostly I spray insecticide for ants and termite prevention around the house, patio, and storage shed. So a cheap sprayer that last 2-4 years is fine.
customer_reviews.author: T Fowl

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I have only used once, but so far it’s easy to assemble and use. Purchased the 2 gallon rather than the 1 after another reviewer suggested. Perfect since I am mixing a gallon of vinegar, salt, and liquid soap to use on weeds. I don’t see how spray handle locks into the on position so I don’t have to hold open, maybe I am missing how to do that. And this model doesn’t seem to have a pressure release, so when finished using you do have to release pressure slowly, and then you need to add water and spray to clean out.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knowing it would eventually fail. It did, but faster than I thought. It lasted perhaps 6 times over less than a year. All of these plastic ones fail, but this this time it was weirder than other times: Pressure still allowed a stream, but only for a second, then it had to rest for a few seconds before it would work again. In addition, releasing the pressure will for sure get residual on your hand, even if you bleed it out. I just bought another cheap one, and consider these disposable after one season.
customer_reviews.author: 44 second review

customer_reviews.title: Will not pressurize
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the larger garden sprayer for years and bought this smaller container for small jobs. However after the first use, which was less than ideal since the pressure did not seem to hold, the sprayer does not pressurize at all. I have followed the instructions and I am also familiar with this brand having owned a working one for years without complaint. Either this is a "lemon" or not of good quality in design and materials. Very frustrating, not to mention a waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: L.D. Clements

customer_reviews.title: Had almost three years--still working without pump failure
customer_reviews.text: Had this sprayer for close to three years or maybe slightly over and still haven't had any issues with pump failure. I used to buy one from Agri Supply and was replacing them every year due to pump failure...seals just enlarge with time and fell off. Not this one...still pumping...still spraying. The only issue I have with the sprayer is that the handle locking mechanism doesn't stay put. When you're walking with the handle in hand, quite often the locking mechanism will come undone and the unit will just fall down the pump shaft. But....I've just been re-locking and keep on working. Hasn't damaged the unit from doing so, thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Harrell

customer_reviews.title: Lasted over 4 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this October 4, 2015. It broke today 12-7-19. The little black plastic tab where you twist on snapped off. Overall this unit worked great. I gave it five stars as it worked perfect for four years. I used outdoor bleach and weed killer in it only. I used it quite a bit. It did not just sit in the garage. The peak of my home is pretty high and this unit will spray all the way up there without the need for ladders. Makes cleaning my home so easy. Holds the pressure well and is easy to refill. I’m pleased and will order another one now.
customer_reviews.author: WannaRip

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased (4) 1 gallon sprayers in the past year. One from Orchard which I took back. Two from Home Depot and this Chapin 20000 which I love. The only negative on this particular sprayer is that it lacks a release valve. So, if you are using pesticide or chemicals you would need to be very careful when removing the top. I use neem oil and other organic solutions so this is not a problem for me. This is one of the best sprayers that I have. LOVE IT.
customer_reviews.author: Barba

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: I recd it and used it the same day. The container is very sturdy. Wish the volume markings were much easier to read. The spray handle (plastic) is delicate in nature. If anything breaks, it will be the spray handle first. The hose is not very flexible and you have to fight it....plastic has memory. But....it holds pressure and does what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Writer

customer_reviews.title: This little sprayer builds up good pressure and seems to build it up with less ...
customer_reviews.text: A small and simple sprayer but it suits my needs. I do wish I had spent a little more and gotten one with a pressure release valve but it isn't a big deal. This little sprayer builds up good pressure and seems to build it up with less effort than my old sprayer of the same size.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gunther

customer_reviews.title: Missing important parts!
customer_reviews.text: 2 stars because mine was missing the part that holds the line in place that goes down into the bottle. I thought I was maybe using it incorrectly because it kept shooting out and spraying me with fertilizer! Ugh. It wasn't a pleasing experience. I ended up wrapping it in electrical tape to hold it in and it's been great. If it'd came with the parts it should have I'd given it 5 stars! But it didn't and I believe buyers should be aware of this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kamila

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and simple to use.
customer_reviews.text: The price is certainly right. It's super simple to use. Instructions are included, but It's pretty straightforward. I use mine to water/fertilize my houseplants. It's an unfailing boss of a garden sprayer. It's modest looking and I like that. It's made of polyurethane and I especially like that it's translucent. It's mess-free filling and easy to pump and carry around. It's so much better than my traditional watering can. I'm glad I have it.
customer_reviews.author: OregoniansTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great for Staining and Sealing Concrete
customer_reviews.text: This was used repeatedly with multiple colors of concrete acid stain, rinsing with baking soda and water to neutralize in between colors/coats. I also used it to apply a water based concrete sealant afterwards. I am happy with the results and the fact that I was able to use this more than once. One star was removed because the nozzle did start to clog/drip over time even though I removed and cleaned it several times... Doing this sometimes helped, but not always. Luckily, this resulted in additional character to my floor pattern, so it was not too detrimental, but it is something to be aware of when using liquids that can develop increased viscosity over time.
customer_reviews.author: JaStar

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I received this right about a month and a half ago. The day I got it, I filled it with vinegar to kill weeds in the garden and acidify the soil. I noticed some weeds in the garden yesterday (6/24/2020), grabbed the sprayer and started to pump it up and vinegar started pumping out of the top of the pump mechanism. Long story short: Used once, left alone for a month and a half and now it doesn't work at all. Yes, I decompressed the sprayer before storing. Yes, the pump mechanism was screwed on tight this last time I tried to use it. Do yourself a favor and just get the good sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Almost Impossible To Seal
customer_reviews.text: To be used for garden. Easy to put together. Unfortunately, when assembled and trying to pressurize it would not seal. Could not get it to hold pressure. After checking assembly, it was disassembled and then reassembled. Still would not hold pressure. I then tried turning the cap using my full strength. It finally sealed. Unfortunately, it was almost impossible to get the top loose enough to vent and remove. My wife, who uses the sprayer, could not do it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Basic pump spray, But for under $13 bucks, it's not to bad(have purchased 2 now)The container is thick and quite sturdy, the pump handle and seal seem fragile while pumping. The spray nozzle looks poorly made, like it will break very easily. There is no pressure relief valve, but it's not difficult to keep the nozzle down to relieve the pressure and store. By no means are these complaints, just observations for other buyers. I am happy with the purchase and it does exactly what I need it to do, if you need something more refined, you won't find it at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Vic&Edith8486

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I have only used the sprayer once on a popcorn ceiling. My other sprayer suddenly stopped working. I had to use 2 small handheld sprayers to soften the popcorn. 4 hours later I was done. My hand and wrist had had a major workout. The Chapin 20000 arrived the next day. Assembling the sprayer was a no-brainer. Two minutes later I was filling the tank testing the pump. The sprayer put out a good stream of water onto the popcorn ceiling. I let it soak and sprayed a second time. I was so pleased. Four hours the day before became 1 hour in a larger room. Excellent sprayer. I will update this review in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: roundrocker

customer_reviews.title: My 9-year old son was so impressed with this he bought one for himself
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and durable. I used it to treat moss on the roof of my house. My 9-yo son was so impressed with this thing that he bought one for himself. After a lecture on active and passive safety, his is artfully-marked with colorful duct-tape and permanent markers and he uses it almost daily to water plants, do water trajectory experiements around the yard and driveway, and clean parts of our walkways with the low-pressure water!
customer_reviews.author: FM Portland

customer_reviews.title: Serious reliability issues with this product
customer_reviews.text: Both of my sprayers stopped working after a couple of months and of course beyond Amazon's warranty period. Forget about contacting Chapin and they neither pick up the phone nor answer emails. I did read through their FAQs and tried a couple of their suggestion but at present neither tank holds pressure and are worthless. I suggest that you spend a bit more money to get a product that actually lasts more than a few months.
customer_reviews.author: rxbartolo

customer_reviews.title: ... Chapin 20000 1-gallon Lawn and Garden sprayer is an excellent buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: The Chapin 20000 1-gallon Lawn and Garden sprayer is an excellent buy for the money. It's light enough to carry around with relative ease and the adjustable spray nozzle gives you a variety of spray patterns with just a simple twist. You can get the sprayer to shoot up to 8-10' depending upon the way you set the adjustable nozzle. I've only used the sprayer with a mixture of equal parts of liquid soap and olive oil as that combination works well in keeping spider mites and white flies in check. Follow the manufacturer's advice if you are going to put anything that is more caustic.
customer_reviews.author: Craig in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and function; one small piece of advice when using
customer_reviews.text: I've waited a few months before submitting this review so that I could judge the utility and durability of this sprayer. On both counts, this gets 5 stars. In addition, this is a very low priced sprayer. One word of advice for users : when finished spraying, hold the top pointed away from you as you unscrew it. Here's why. There is always a bit of pressure left in the sprayer. If you don't point it away, a mist of sprayer contents will go to your face and body. The results could range from amusing to dangerous depending on the sprayer contents. I have to remind myself of this everytime I use this sprayer
customer_reviews.author: Marthaman

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is a pretty good sprayer. It is well-built, easy to assemble and works well. There are several things I wish were different, but I guess if I wanted those I should have ordered a more expensive sprayer. The pressure pump has a pretty short stroke, so it takes a lot of strokes to pump it up. There is no provision for a shoulder strap nor is there any provision for clipping the wand to the sprayer when it is not in use. The spray is easy to adjust from a steady stream to a fanned out mist so the sprayer does the job it is intended for very well.
customer_reviews.author: 1yrloose

customer_reviews.title: Works but not as fine as hoped
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for indoor pest control. I had hoped it would have a finer spray pattern than my current sprayer. It doesn't. This might be very good for outdoor pesticide/herbicide but that's not why I bought it. I need something with a fine spray pattern that mimics the pesticide sprayers that come on the consumer gallon jugs. This one is too wide/course and drips a bit when spraying stopped. 3 stars cause it does what it's supposed and was easy to enough to assemble. Just didn't meet my expectations/needs.
customer_reviews.author: Tech-61912

customer_reviews.title: So far loving it
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it twice so far; but loving it! We make up our own weedkiller - dish soap, vinegar, epsom salts. For years I have been using a sprayer bottle to apply it - holy slow going! With this I applied far more, in a fraction of the time. I only hope it will prove as durable and reliable as it was easy to use. Literally had it filled up, applied just under a gallon around the yard, and cleaned up in less time, than it usually takes me to do one sprayer bottle (a quart sprayer bottle)! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rdogg48

customer_reviews.title: Terrific bargin purchase... .but... .
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this almost a year ago now and thought I was going to have to purchase another or an alternative since it was no longer holding pressure and squirting fluid. I took the filter hose out and cleaned it and all is well now! It was covered in such milky goop from the ROUNDUP weed killer that I could barely see filter holes and never really knew any were there since I'd never pulled the hose up from the canister before. Properly cleaning the unit is a critical need or it'll seize up on you. I've decided to keep the filter hose OUTSIDE the canister if leftover weed killer fluid is inside.
customer_reviews.author: M. Reid

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Works good only suggestion I would have is to maybe have a release valve to release pressure. Only used it a couple times so far, and the first time I ended up spraying ortho product on my face as there was product on the lid. Partly my fault as I should have been more careful filling it, but a valve seems it would be safer to release pressure in tank.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: I used it and the problem I had was it acted like it had a clogged sprayer I took it apart ...
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I purchased this one gallon sprayer. I used it and the problem I had was it acted like it had a clogged sprayer I took it apart and cleaned it rinsed it and still a problem. I pump it up as hard as I can and it will spray steady for maybe 2 or 3 seconds and go to a dribble. I think I have a defective unit. I am off to Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Heather D

customer_reviews.title: Received a defective pump sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Defective. The pump handle is like permanently welded in the lock position. My husband and I spent 30 minutes doing exactly what the instructions said to do (push down on handle and turn 1/4 turn counter-clockwise) to release the handle to be able to pump it. The handle wouldn’t budge and the action always began unscrewing the entire pump assembly. We eventually gave up. The manufacturers web site to order parts was worthless and no one answered the phone for customer service. We are sending it back and ordering a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: The screw-on seal leaks badly.
customer_reviews.text: This worked fine in the beginning, but after a month or two it started leaking air . I've verified the seal is there, I've changed seals, put in bigger seals, smaller seals, sealing along with plumber's putty, everything I can think of. I studied and examined the thing, trying to figure out WHY it's leaking. It's become useless to me. My best guess is it warped in the Arizona heat. I give it two stars because I'm happy Someone is making a large sprayer like this.
customer_reviews.author: BigSmiler

customer_reviews.title: It does the job much better than my Ortho
customer_reviews.text: I use this for spraying weeds with weedkiller. I especially liked the built-in 'funnel' for filling instead of having to use a separate one. I would appreciate an add-on extension for the wand if there is one. The spray nozzle works very well and I can adjust it to suit what I'm doing. All in all; a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival (DOA)
customer_reviews.text: The item just fell apart upon delivery. The pump does not work, no matter how many times you push that handle. so it's like an exercise machine. You can develop your muscles but not pump the air into the sprayer. I'm not sure if the manufacture. making this device has EVER had a quality control. This is an item that won't worth a penny. It can bring to the customer everything - frustration, disappointment, etc but not what he/she expects to see after the package arrives. Unbelievable garbage!
customer_reviews.author: blevotina

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for ....
customer_reviews.text: Worked great the very first time I used it. The second time ... it wouldn't release all the pressure in the container. I would get about a 5 second squirt then nothing. I would go through the process of loosening the valve, let the pressure escape, tighten everything up, pump it and have the same thing happen. I decided to purchase a different one that cost a bit more ... we'll see how that one works
customer_reviews.author: Sz

customer_reviews.title: It works for what I need
customer_reviews.text: Quality lacking a little on this product. The one I got had a lot of sharp edges around the seams of the mold used to make it. Even had plastic shavings inside the sprayer that if I didn't notice before filling could have damaged the pump. Speaking of the pump while pumping this thing up it sounds like a dolphin in distress, horrible noise...had every dog in the neighborhood barking. No real latching mechanism for pump handle so as you are walking with it it can turn causing the sprayer bottle to drop.
customer_reviews.author: Laura C

customer_reviews.title: Anti-clog got clogged - useless
customer_reviews.text: We rarely use this sprayer, only when we have a plant with some pests, and maybe once a year to remove rust on the driveway. Well, we used twice, everything was fine. Went to use it for the third time after sitting for about 6 months, and sure enough it was totally clogged. The handle part with the spray lever is plain and simply clogged. I verified it is not the pickup, not the spray wand, it is very specifically the black handle part with the lever. Nothing will go through. Crap.
customer_reviews.author: Philc2001

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This worked beautifully for about 20 minutes. In fact, for a short period of time, I thought it was the best sprayer I had ever used. It very quickly stopped working and all efforts to get it to work properly failed. Despite following the very clear and well written instructions for troubleshooting, I was never able to get it to work again. At this price point and after being filled with lawn chemicals, it was not worth the trouble to return. It ended up in the trash can.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and operate. Effective and efficient.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Only improvement would be a clip for the hose so it’s not just dragging on the ground when you hold it, and a pressure release valve. Currently you have turn the tub over and then open the nozzle on the hose, but that is a huge hassle and of course the hose still has liquid in it so it will still spurt and sputter a bit. Also the other, less expensive models came with different nozzle heads... don’t know why mine didn’t. Seems like a cheap move. But overall, works exactly like you’d want. Easy to use and operate.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. It's junk. Has very little power, and doesn't hold suction very long. Works like a dollar store water gun, but worse. Harry is spinning in his grave that his surname is attached to the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for movie magic blood work.
customer_reviews.text: Alright so let me start off by saying that I did not use this for spraying pesticides or fertilizer. I used it for filmmaking. So I made some blood for a death scene with microcrystalline cellulose. And then watered it down a bit to ooze blood from a wood. Some surgical tubing glued to the sprayer nozzle and pump it up. Instant bleed out. So let’s just say that for what I used it for it’s perfect. Adequate pressure and cleaned out nicely. Probably works great for the things that it was made to spray.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: tip for using with roundup
customer_reviews.text: Roundup has additives (surfactants) to help stick the active ingredient to leaves. Unfortunately these additives also gum up the inlet of this sprayer. So if you use this sprayer with Roundup you will have to rinse off the inlet to remove the goop. For me that is once or twice a year. The sprayer works fine. added 5-2020 I also have a half gallon Chapin sprayer which is crap primarily due to a poorly designed inlet. Think that I got it at that big box orange store. Just ordered a second one of these to replace it. Use one sprayer for Roundup and one for deer repellent.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bolton

customer_reviews.title: stay away, Russian roulette...
customer_reviews.text: Bought one & loved it. Have 5 stars. Then just broke 8/5, had 21⁄2-3 weeks. Liquid spraying from top of handle pump! After first week, liked so much bought second unit. Came broke! Did replacement & seems to be okay, so far ;-) Than I went return this broken one still in 30 days & want nee to skip back broke unit or still be charged, & I'm paying for shipping. Nice Amazon, & can't email anyone like a company 3rd party seller... So, as they are okay, it's a Russian roulette if get a good unit or bad & how long will last. I'd say, stay away & spend extra $10 to get better one cuz this is RIDICULOUS!
customer_reviews.author: LiteKid

customer_reviews.title: Loved the first one, just bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: I have four acres of land encircled with an electric fence that needs weed control to function properly. In seven years, I've gone through a few sprayers, most disappointed me with faulty sprayer patterns, weak spray, etc. I bought this guy last year and just ordered a second. Not because the first gave out but I needed another one for another chemical. Despite a lot of use over it's first year, the first one still works like it was new. Nothing says a happy customer like purchasing the same thing again!
customer_reviews.author: DakotaTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: good for spraying kelp fertilizer
customer_reviews.text: Works great. We're using it to put watered-down liquid kelp (GS brand, also from amazon) over all the nice plants in the yard. It hasn't clogged yet, after about 10-15 refills/uses. I had a couple of instances where I exploded kelp spray all over myself --smells exactly as good as you'd guess-- until I realized you really, really have to squirt all the air out before you open the container. That was probably in the directions. Anyway, it's working out well for us and the plants seem happy.
customer_reviews.author: MisterPlow

customer_reviews.title: Like Pumping A Keg In College!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a sprayer to use for killing moss on my lawn. The recommended mixture i used per the internet was 1 gallon of water to 2 oz. of dish soap. I gave it a shot and this thing sprayed like a dream. Pumping the sprayer reminded me of my college days where we spent countless pumps at the keg. Imagine pumping, pumping and pumping and no foam! It was that delightful. at any rate, if you're looking for a no frills sprayer, this is it. Sprays well.
customer_reviews.author: Sang H. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Good spray. Cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: Numerous obvious failure points, though I suppose they're safety-feature-esque given the nature of the device. (Pressure vessel.) Needs a wide base and a better way to carry it than the handle. It does what you expect, and how, but there's a lot of room for improvement quality wise. Though the tank itself seems more than solid enough, the fittings (pump and spray attachment) are questionable at best. Can get a really good spray out of it though.
customer_reviews.author: Pirate_Joke

customer_reviews.title: Garbage, didn't even make it an entire garden season.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this sprayer at the end of April and by mid-July it was no longer working. Didn't even make it the summer. The suction straw thing appears to have warped and whenever you try and pump it to get pressure in the base the seal is broken around the top making it useless. We used the sprayer for white vinegar only, and since that comes in a plastic bottle you wouldn't think it would hard a plastic POS spray bottle.
customer_reviews.author: kdoug

customer_reviews.title: I had to repair two small leaks on the bottom of the tank
customer_reviews.text: After assembling I mixed two gallons of a weed killer and immediately noticed two small leaks on the bottom of the tank even before pressurizing it. Rather than find somewhere to store the expensive week killer and deal with a return I was able to tip the sprayer on it's side and repair the leaks with a plastic welder I have and haven't had any issues since. The sprayer works very well so far so I'll give it three stars for that but I have to knock off two stars for a lack of quality control.
customer_reviews.author: KJH

customer_reviews.title: good quality,  petty easy to use,  2 gallons gets heavy fyi
customer_reviews.text: this thing is great! I live in an urban area where a water holes is a luxury. I have a tiny patch where I plant flowers and a few tomatoes and this is the perfect amount of water for them. There was a slight leaning curve but I really didn't read anything but I figured it out. It's nice heavy plastic. A better handle would be nice it does pop up because it's what you use to pump maybe a separate handle would have been better. Tip- Don't over pump
customer_reviews.author: r.cruz

customer_reviews.title: Continuous flow based on pressure, no hose required, 1 gallon tank
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid container gardener in CA, and have frequent issues with powdery mildew. I have spent countless hours and money purchasing the spray bottle neem oils, well no more! This baby solves the difficulty in hand fatigue and time spraying each leaf on large plants, I love it! 1. Mix your solution in the gallon tank. (HINT: This is a significant cost saving as you can buy the solutions as a concentrate!). 2. Screw on the top and pump it easily to provide bottle pressure. 3. Hold down the sprayer and get a continuous stream to quickly and easily cover your entire plant. Strongly suggest this for anyone with large plants. Happy Gardening!
customer_reviews.author: Tina S.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, be careful about back-pressure when you open the tank.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this twice on poison oak on a large parcel, and it's worked well. Spray adjustment is okay, but I don't think it's great. The spray I want, medium, no drips, no mist, comes out in a cone shape with spray at the perimeter of the cone. What I'd rather have is a cone pattern that sprays throughout the cone shape. More importantly, unscrews the mail fill cap VERY slowly to avoid the internal pressure pushing whatever you're spraying up and into your face. Thankfully, I learned this when I first used clear water in a test of the sprayer! Overall, very good sprayer at a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher E

customer_reviews.title: Did not last very long before failure
customer_reviews.text: The plastic tabs that allow the pump handle to lock in place to open the water container broke off after a few months of light use, leaving the whole thing useless. Not durable at all to regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Hershel Don

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Easy
customer_reviews.text: I use this to periodically spray a diluted bleach solution onto patio furniture. I was tired of replacing spray bottles whose spray nozzles would fatigue my hands and eventually fail after one season of use. Now what used to take 30-45 minutes only takes 10-15 max. - no stopping to refill bottles or rest my hands. Fairly easy to assemble (no tools needed) but had to look at directions carefully to figure out which ends of hose and sprayer go where. Still, it only took about 5-10 minutes to unpackage and assemble.
customer_reviews.author: ellen_ig

customer_reviews.title: The plastic body is sturdy but the hose wouldn't fit properly into the tank ...
customer_reviews.text: JUNK. Had high expectations. The plastic body is sturdy but the hose wouldn't fit properly into the tank fitting (fitting defect) and the fitting was loose and would not tighten - couldn't safely pressurized. My wife didn't start the return as I wanted. Threw it away...what a shame.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: it works, but it is cheaply constructed
customer_reviews.text: it does work, but don't expect it to last long. worse part is the light plast used in the handle. i can actually bend it (and the first time thought i'd never get it open) when removing it. you have to get it tight to prevent leaks, but then if feels like you will twist the top off trying to unscrew it. if you are getting for a disposable project, great. or as long as you know it is not that tough, you are ok.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts, so it's basically unusable
customer_reviews.text: The product I got was missing most of the parts. Unfortunately I got sick and didn't open the box until after the return window closed. Couldn't connect the sprayer wand because a piece was missing, so I ended up having to drizzle the liquid out of the end of the nozzle where the squeeze trigger is. I was just using vinegar/water/dish soap mix, but I wouldn't have felt comfortable with this method for chemicals, because it was hard to control the spray and it did splash on me a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia T

customer_reviews.title: I had another one of these; I bought this because it costs less...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this type before. It' s cheap enough and works for awhile. However, I've never known these to last for long. My folks used them for their roses when they had them. They give out and flood through the top after awhile. Sometimes you have to struggle with them. As I mentioned, these work good for the price; be sure to clean it well or something (if you use strong toxic weed killer - not easy). I would prefer an adjustable nozzle. Nozzle will clog.
customer_reviews.author: BetsyRoss

customer_reviews.title: Best sprayer I've owned - trigger is very stiff compared to others, but excellent in other regards
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sprayer, although the trigger is a bit stiff to use. Performs excellent in all other regards, especially with the flow and mist quality. I used one with water-soluble fertilizer and used another with neem oil, peppermint oil, castile soap, and cayenne for spraying veggies (natural fungicide/pesticide).
customer_reviews.author: Grey S

customer_reviews.title: Update: Cheaply made.  Seam leaked with barely any usage.
customer_reviews.text: Update: only used once and it sat it my garage for over a year. When I used it for the second time there was a leak at the seams on the plastic container (not the pump assembly). Unusable now. I doubt glue would be suffice for a pump spray that requires pressure. Old review: Pretty straight forward assembly. Material and quality seemed cheap but get what you pay for. Pumping feels awkward at times. Sometimes it doesn't feel like it's building up pressure. But when it does the Spray comes out fine with twist nozzle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Review Noob

customer_reviews.title: Takes the place of a hose for spraying yard and washing driveway.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well made, the sprayer works like a hose providing great coverage of my yard. I really like that I didn’t have to constantly press the trigger. It will go as long as you have the water pumped into the tubing (hose). The pumping is very easy. The only thing that would make this product perfect is if it had a handle on it. Otherwise does a very efficient job for spraying your yard with needing to hook up an actual hose.
customer_reviews.author: MikkifrAZ

customer_reviews.title: item causes reproductive harm
customer_reviews.text: There is no need for their brass material to cause reproductive harm, they could choose other materials but manufacturer prefers to earn profit over the safety of customers. So I used gloves (hassle) but more importantly, this pumping function would not work. I read the instructions carefully, as well as reviews on this issue. No water came out because pumping mechanism is defective. I returned item to merchant. I'm not a bot, was not paid to write this review.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Simple but terrific pressure
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple but terrific little sprayer. It holds its pressure extremely well and I can almost use the entire gallon with one good pump up. It has a straight end on it so sometimes the angle is a problem and it doesn’t have a lock down to hold the spray lever down so one must keep hand pressure on it the entire time. It also never seems to plug up on the end which is amazing. I would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Deepgreen

customer_reviews.title: Works but if I had to do over, I’d buy a better one.
customer_reviews.text: Works but if I had to do over, I’d buy a better one. No pressure release, so to relieve pressure you have to unscrew plunger and when you unscrew plunger you get sprayed with most of whatever you have in the tank. This could be dangerous depending on what you have in the tank. No shoulder strap and no variety of spray tips. On the positive side the deer spray I’m using with it is kind of thick, but the sprayer isn’t clogging.
customer_reviews.author: beemer bruce

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work at all
customer_reviews.text: Terrible ! We couldn’t get it to work properly at all. There was so many problems right out of the box and it would not pump. I took to long to open the box and the product was also late arriving here. I was so busy and missed the return window. What a regret!
customer_reviews.author: A Lee

customer_reviews.title: Spay pattern is a cone shape
customer_reviews.text: First off I wanted to say that the initial assembly, inserting the hose into the tank. I had to unscrew the place where it the tube slides into the tank. The filter at the end wouldn't go in. After I finished using it I pulled the hose out and the filter came off the end of the hose. I got this for applying weed killer and was disappointed to see that the spray pattern is more of a cone / circle pattern then just a flat spray.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Chapin 2000 Sprayer is a Worthless!
customer_reviews.text: I followed the simple assembly directions to be able to spray some insecticide. Once put together, no matter how much I pumped the handle to pressurize the tank in order for it to spray nothing worked. I spent an hour trying to get this item to work. It is worthless and I wish I could get my money back! I was so angre I threw it out and figured it was to late to get a refund. But, then, too, returning would be such a hassle! Not worth you money, folks!
customer_reviews.author: PNR16

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome and very functional sprayer -- i initially got this to spray the yard for mosquitos with a garlic solution, and in the process discovered that it is a great plain water mister as well. **The plastic does retain the smell for a while of whatever was in the container -- garlic is especially pungent, but i can still smell it when refilling the sprayer after several months of weekly use.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't handle  sufficient pressure
customer_reviews.text: Afer pumping the sprayer, the pump sprayed into my face. This happened several times. In order for that to not happen, I could only pump very few times. I had to pump often because there was less pressure and the sprayer wouldn't spray for long. This made a drawn out time of the task at hand.
customer_reviews.author: CynthE

customer_reviews.title: Defective.
customer_reviews.text: Cannot connect the hose to the can because the thread sizes are different! Really strange! I have to return it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Alf

customer_reviews.title: Just the right ticket for my .35 acre
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one...lost the original in a split up so, I've re-upped for another and it's great. Oh, when it's full at a gallon, don't pump more than about 5-6 strokes. After that, the lower the fluid volume, the more strokes it takes to properly pressurize...
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Peartree

customer_reviews.title: Pumping mechanism broke on the second use. Truly disappointed ☹️
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product to use on weeds in my front yard. Used a gallons worth of vinegar yard spray and it worked fine. The second gallon I tried to use but the pump broke. Pretty disappointing considering it’s a 2 gallon sprayer. Couldn’t even make it through 2 gallons.
customer_reviews.author: EMMA LEWIS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent no frills sprayer. Some drilling required?
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say about this very good sprayer. Good: Light and sturdy Easily adjustable nozzle Simple pump / carry handle Sprays varying viscosity liquids without issue Translucent, so liquid levels are apparent Flat sturdy bottom so it stands on its own Impressive pressure for decent mist for ranged stream Not so good: Easy to assemble except; I had to manually drill the hole for the hose myself, as it was not pre-drilled as advertised. Overall: If you’re in the market for a do-it-all general sprayer, you could do a lot worse than this one. Just have a drill handy in case. ; ) Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Random_David

customer_reviews.title: WARNING!!!
customer_reviews.text: WARNING! This plastic will degrade over time. I’ve stored mine outside in a shaded area and on concrete. It was not under pressure. It has been a couple of years since last use. When I filled it up today and pumped pressure into the chamber, it exploded. Thank goodness I was not looking at it, though it left some red marks on my stomach (through my shirt). This is a cheap plastic item that works great new but is only good for a limited time. BE CAREFUL!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Buy a better product
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use this with concentrated weed killer designed to be mixed with water. Followed all the instructions--sprayer worked for a short time but then would not hold pressure nor spray. Cleaning spray mechanism did not solve the issue. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Laurel

customer_reviews.title: Hard to maneuver, and stopped spraying
customer_reviews.text: I returned this. It's difficult to unscrew just the pump without unscrewing the whole top assembly. I thought maybe I just had to get used to it but then it stopped spraying altogether very soon after I got it. I used it for a mixture of cayenne pepper and water that I sprayed on my flowers to repel animals. I put the mixture through a strainer multiple times but there was still a small amount of residue that could have clogged it. However I completely cleaned the sprayer filter and still no luck. I feel it's cheaply made because when I borrowed a similar sprayer from a friend, I didn't have the problems with the assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Pam W.

customer_reviews.title: a great inexpensive sprayer...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a couple of these type of sprayers after getting fed up with the ones that come with the typical weed sprays. This sprayer does everything I want it to do and it is light and portable. I read some of the negative reviews and they have some valid concerns, but if you want a sprayer with pressure relief capability then you really should spend more than $12. The volume of the 1 gal sprayer is small enough that you can relieve the pressure by holding the sprayer open for a short period of time. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Used for three months, then kaput.
customer_reviews.text: The fluid intake stem at the bottom of the tank became clogged and I had to unscrew the assembly from the side of the tank to take the stem out and unclog it. Now it leaks air under pressure and I can’t fix it with plumber’s tape or anything else. It’s also leaking air around the water intake/pump/handle. The plastic is too soft to risk screwing these things down any harder. It was an inexpensive item, but good grief, I expected more than one season out of it!
customer_reviews.author: Poppysmom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I am in my 60’s and disabled, I was using a one gallon one. But since there is so much area that needs to be sprayed I ended up wearing myself out running in and out filling it just for the convenience of the bottle not being heavy. So I ordered this one. I have a lawn and garden wagon and I put it on there and pull it with me around the yard and not running in and out to mix and refil
customer_reviews.author: janice

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is a low-cost, no-frills sprayer. It does the job at a good price but offers no extras. The spray pattern is adjustable over a limited range. There is no pressure relief, so you must keep spraying until it goes down; even then you may get a little spray from residual pressure when you open the lid. The one quart size means more refills but is easy to carry even when full. Cleaning is easy but you have to spray for some time to get all the material washed out of the hose.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase.  Does not work.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use for the spraying of rabbit repellent in my garden. Before use, the directions said to first fill with just water to make certain it works correctly. After reading the directions carefully, I filled it with water and pumped the handle as they directed. Regardless how many times I pumped, there was no pressure, and no water (not even a drop) came from the sprayer. I was very disappointed. Perhaps just the one I received was a "lemon," but I would recommend not purchasing it. I would have rated the product with "zero," but that was not an option.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah H. Shultz

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 7 weeks
customer_reviews.text: 30 day warranty/return expired on June 11th. Purchased on May 7th. Its June 29th and the valve doesn't open to let product come out. Took all the pieces apart. No water or air will go through the valve when I press the lever. I only use this once every other week or so. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: VickiR

product_meta.title: Chapin 20000 Garden Sprayer 1 Gallon Lawn
product_meta.description:
Size:1 Gallon SprayerThe Chapin 1-Gallon Poly Lawn and Garden sprayer is ideal for weed control, pest control and fertilizers. It features Chapin's unique in-tank anti-clog filter, for a clog-free, steady spray. An ergonomic pump handle makes pumping and carrying easy. The lightweight, rust-free polyethylene tank is translucent so it's easy to check fluid levels.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Our residential, professional and industrial sprayers are designed to meet the needs of your lawn, garden, home, farm, professional, or commercial project. With a focus on innovation gained through industry knowledge, Chapin products have been manufactured with excellence in the United States using global components for more than 130 years. We offer full technical support at 800-950-4458 to help you find the right sprayer for your application or visit our website at chapinmfg.com for more product information and specifications. Chapin, the way to spray since 1884.
feature_bullets: 1-Gallon funnel-top, translucent tank for easy filling and cleaning
Compatible with common fertilizers, weed killers and pesticides
Ergonomic handle for easy pumping and carrying

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars17,656 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
